description: An illustration of the Kaaba, a stone building that sits in the center of Mecca, a holy site for Muslims: it is a cube-shaped building made largely of dark black stone with two thin gold stripes wrapping around the building and a large gold door on the front side. There is a low semicircular stone wall to the right of the Kaaba, which was part of the original Kaaba (damaged in 683 A.D. during a siege).

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
